alert.note: Alert for Grimes (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 6:14PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Grimes County through 645 PM CDT... At 614 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Anderson, or 10 miles east of Navasota, moving north at around 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Anderson and Richards. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
